discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Going with A here. The search here has a column for IP search summary. I don't see any info around detections, unmanaged hosts, or a threat graph.
correct answer is D

questions.question_text: Which of the following is returned from the IP Search tool?

choices.B: Threat Graph Data for the given IP from Falcon sensors
choices.D: IP Detection Summary information for detection events containing the given IP
choices.C: Unmanaged host data from system ARP tables for the given IP
choices.A: IP Summary information from Falcon events containing the given IP

questions.question_text: What types of events are returned by a Process Timeline?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
answer B, B. All cloudable events. All events is sent to falcon cloud.

Selected Answer: B
All events that is sent to cloud.

Selected Answer: B
Was on the practice test

Selected Answer: A
This is A . Process Timeline filters show Agent ID, Target Process ID, EVENT TYPES, Company, and Time Range.
correct answer is C

questions.question_text: After running an Event Search, you can select many Event Actions depending on your results. Which of the following is NOT an option for any Event Action?

choices.C: Show a Process Timeline for the responsible process
choices.D: Show Associated Event Data (from TargetProcessId_decimal or ContextProcessId decimal)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer is C, C. Show a Process Timeline for the responsible process 

the question is asking "NOT".

It cannot show the timeline, it show the log one by one, but it can show all the process detail and the related information

Selected Answer: C
The real statement is: "View Process Explorer for the responsible process"

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer. This is not an option in the Event Actions drop-down. The others do show in the drop-down.
correct answer is A

Selected Answer: C
i change my vote to C show a process timeline for the responsible process is NOT an option. what makes very picky question/answer is that there is an option: Show responsible Process Data ~ listed answer Show a process timeline for rhe responsible process ??? CrowdStrike documentation is really poor and these questions do not match up to the questions. i got the info from 201m detection triage

Selected Answer: A
the others are real event actions

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer It is in the definition on Mitre site
answer is c

questions.question_text: What information does the MITRE ATT&CK Framework provide?

choices.D: It is a system that attributes attack techniques to a specific threat actor
choices.A: It provides best practices for different cybersecurity domains, such as Identify and Access Management
choices.C: It provides the phases of an adversary's lifecycle, the platforms they are known to attack, and the specific methods they use
choices.B: It provides a step-by-step cyber incident response strategy

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B, B. Select Full Detection Details from the detection 

just one click to click "see full detection", then it will show everything.

Selected Answer: B
Going with B. There is no Right click, the Process Tree does now show this info, and the Event search does not show any process info for Child/Siblings. B is the only place to see the main process then broken out into child/subs
The correct answer is B. There are no "right-click" options in the console.

Selected Answer: A
checked ind be docs

Selected Answer: B
Other options do not seem the fastest way

Selected Answer: B
Right click gives you basic web/OS options, nothing application specific. This is more appropriate since the details and tree are provided with full details.

choices.B: Select Full Detection Details from the detection
choices.A: Select the Event Search option. Then from the Event Actions, select Show Associated Event Data (From TargetProcessId_decimal)
choices.D: Select the Process Timeline feature, enter the AID, Target Process ID, and Parent Process ID
choices.C: Right-click the process and select "Follow Process Chain"

questions.question_text: From a detection, what is the fastest way to see children and sibling process information?
